Information: used to precede a comment, #this is a comment
used to refer to columns within a data frame, dataframe$column
shows the help file for that command, for example, ?help or ?head
will search through the help files for any reference to the word you type, ??dataframe
square brackets are used to refer to specific elements in a list or data frame.  pop2011[1,] will show the first row and pop2011[,1] will show the first column.
assigns a value or output from a function to a variable
adds vertical lines to a histogram, used to show classification breaks abline(v = breaks$brks, col = “red”)
aggregate the specified data set by a column, applying a function to the values, aggregate(x = LSOA_crimes, by = list(LSOA_crimes$lsoa21cd), FUN = length)
calculate the class invervals for the specified data, classIntervals(var, n = 6, style = "fisher")

used to create a list, either numbers c(1,2,3) or strings (text)
c("Thomas","Richard","Harriet")
shows the names and numbers of the columns in the specified data set, colnames(hp.data)
shows all the potential colour paletts from the RColorBrewer library
download a file from the specificed URL: download.file("http://www.nickbearman.me.uk/data/r/sthelens.zip","sthelens.zip")
used to specify we don't want something, e.g. frame = F means we don't want a frame
begins a loop to make R repeat a command a set number of times, for (i in 1:length(mapvariables))
used to show the first six rows of the data frame, head(hp.data)
shows a histogram of the specified data, hist(var)
load the specified library, library(sf)
calculate the mean of the specified set of values, mean(house.prices)
joins two data frames together using a specified attribute or ID, merge(LSOA, pop2021, by.x="lsoa21cd", by.y="geography.code")
a quick way of showing spatial data, either just the data itself, qtm(LSOA), or a quick choropleth map, qtm(LSOA_crimes_aggregated, fill = "count of crimes")
read in a csv file from the specified path, read.csv("police-uk-2020-04-merseyside-street.csv")
set the working directory to the specified folder, setwd("C:/Users/nick/Documents/work/intro-r-spatial-analysis/data-user")
use to create a spatial data frame from a non spatial data frame, st_as_sf(crimes, coords = c('Longitude', 'Latitude'), crs = 4326)
do a spatial join, st_join(LSOA, crimes_sf_bng)
read in a shapefile, st_read("england_lsoa_2021.shp")
reproject the specified spatial data object to the specified crs, st_transform(crimes_sf, crs = 27700)
save the specified spatial data object as a shapefile, st_write(LSOA_crimes_aggregated, "LSOA-crime-count.shp")
used to specify that we do want something, legend.hist = T meanse we want to show the legend histogram
count how many different values there are in the specificed column, and output as a table, table(crimes_sf_bng$Crime.type)
specify the location of the title on a map, title.position = c(0.7, "top")
specify the colour and thickness of a border around a map
specify the location of the north arrow / compass on a map, tm_compass(position = c(0.3, 0.07))
specify the symbology of a point layer on a map, tm_dots(size = 0.1, shape = 19, col = "darkred", alpha = 0.5)
specify a range of options in the map layout, tm_layout(frame = F, title = "Liverpool", title.size = 2)
specify the symbology and options of a polygon layer on a map, ttm_polygons("Age00to04", title = "Aged 0 to 4", palette = "Greens", n = 6, style = "jenks")
specify the location and style of the scale bar on a map, tm_scale_bar(width = 0.22, position = c(0.05, 0.18)) +
specify the layer shown on a map, often used in conjunction with tm_polygons(), tm_shape(LSOA)
change the tmap mode from plot (default) to view (slippy map with basemap) or back, tmap_mode("view"),  tmap_mode("plot")
save the map to a specified output file, tmap_save(m, filename = paste0("map-",mapvariables[i],".png"))
unzip the specificed file, unzip("sthelens.zip")
view the specified data in a new tab in Rstudio, View(hp.data)
